ygData.subject: Re: EQ - worse rpg ever?
ygData.msgSnippet: In a message dated 15/07/99 10:45:37 GMT Daylight Time, Supafly16@aol.com writes:
ygData.messageBody:
In a message dated 15/07/99 10:45:37 GMT Daylight Time, Supafly16@...
writes:

<< Etc, etc..the list goes on. I expected these things to happen, but I have
never met a single perons in EQ that actually tried to adhere to their
character. The world of EQ is full of greed and who can be the next '
coolest high level character'. >>

There are some, but like I said few and far between.... keep searching and
you will find them. I have met all the types you talk about, and yes have
slipped from charachter a lot myself - iots HARD work when you are in the
minority. However, all my charachters have a strong declared path, and they
pretty much keep to it... as I get better at it the pretty much will
disappear.... non-roleplayers [most] bring flashes of reality... haha I get
enough of that in rl ;-).

Lifegiver
